commit_message:
Add support for cinder backend availability zones

Add the ability to override the "backend_availability_zone" parameter
in every cinder volume backend.

Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-cinder-volume-az
Depends-On: I11821a38d8ba5afc594b3d601cd1634207a6f093
Change-Id: Ic407b747474b567858ad36beabc8a7d8c5022343

commit_message:
Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

Task: 22576
Story: 2002728
Change-Id: I66820369b889e16445cad7a48cd0f458aae1c41f
(cherry picked from commit a28e5609f991ce32255f7badcad2514ca8e66ab8)

messages:
[{'account_id': 28556, 'date': '2018-06-27 10:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-27 10:52:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This will not work as is, a few suggestions: 
1) This is not connected to accepting arguments from the CLI or API, it will not even work. I suggest using the label arg and adding it to k8s_template_def.py.
2) The field is optional as well so should be made somewhat optional for the users. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/cloud-providers/
3) Update the doc/source/user/index.rst to show this label update and explanation of its usage.
4) Provide a release note (reno new my-change)
5) On new python code, update the unit/coverage testing.'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Overall though the rest of the change is suitable and the is a great feature addition :)'}, {'account_id': 28556, 'date': '2018-06-28 06:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This will not work as is, a few suggestions:
 > 1) This is not connected to accepting arguments from the CLI or
 > API, it will not even work. I suggest using the label arg and
 > adding it to k8s_template_def.py.
 > 2) The field is optional as well so should be made somewhat
 > optional for the users. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/cloud-providers/
 > 3) Update the doc/source/user/index.rst to show this label update
 > and explanation of its usage.
 > 4) Provide a release note (reno new my-change)
 > 5) On new python code, update the unit/coverage testing.

In the current patchset value "region_name" already populated in kubecluster.yaml via the get_params method of k8s_fedora_template_def.py.

Do I understand correctly that better way is to provide a new parameter via the new cluster template label?
And also update write-kube-os-config.sh so region parameter will be set only if that parameter is not empty.'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-28 20:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"In the current patchset value "region_name" already populated in kubecluster.yaml via the get_params method of k8s_fedora_template_def.py."
Actually, yep you're right! Ignore the rest since it wont be a python change. I didn't realize region was already present from another configuration (volume-service.sh)

"And also update write-kube-os-config.sh so region parameter will be set only if that parameter is not empty." yeah this would be great

Lastly still provide a release note (if you're not familiar) https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html#creating-new-release-notes'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The code looks good for me. It would be nice if you can add a release note. Cheers.'}, {'account_id': 28556, 'date': '2018-06-29 07:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28556, 'date': '2018-06-29 12:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-29 12:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Spyros didnt we want to maintain a POSIX format e.g. [[ vs ['}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

otherwise @Andrei looks great thanks!'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-06-29 21:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

commit_message:
Corrected release config location for log collection

Fixes problem where log collection was using config files from
old location after we already switched deployment to use new location.

This was not observed because the file content was the same but
once we attempted to remove the old files we discovered the issue.

Prepares for removal of config files from their old location.

Change-Id: I70aeb3724d6d162aa6d8b00024f3ce1a74dbf79f
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/7

commit_message:
Use keystone_auth for credentials

Magnum requires credentials to be stored inside keystone_auth
in order to be able to properly talk to other services.  This
patch addresses that and moves those settings in the right place.

Change-Id: I8e8b3f769ae58aa8d7ceb22eaf264865790afeed

commit_message:
Disable sending metrics for clusters

There is a reported issue in Magnum which makes clusters fail
to provision if the cluster stat reporting is enabled with
Kuberentes 4.0.0

This patch disables it as the recommended workaround until this
is resolved upstream.

Change-Id: I91d4873d94ce85a0768c441df9e0701da1706115

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-14 06:21:08.000000000', 'message': 'Bugfix: Add datasource_name to an entity also on update

The vitrage_datasource_name property should
be added to every vertex, to allow its late
deletion by the consistency enforcer if
needed [1].
Until now this property was added only at
vertex creation. It should be added also at
vertex update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588219/

Change-Id: I49a0a008b18805cc247cbe1c7b9ccf156c4bae9f
'}]
commit_message:
Bugfix: Add datasource_name to an entity also on update

The vitrage_datasource_name property should
be added to every vertex, to allow its late
deletion by the consistency enforcer if
needed [1].
Until now this property was added only at
vertex creation. It should be added also at
vertex update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588219/

Change-Id: I49a0a008b18805cc247cbe1c7b9ccf156c4bae9f

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You still need to change the workflow to not publish to zaqar, right?'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-09-26 19:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> You still need to change the workflow to not publish to zaqar,
 > right?

you mean the actual workflow in tripleo-common? i don't so. why?"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-09-26 19:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:52:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > You still need to change the workflow to not publish to zaqar,
 > > right?
 > 
 > you mean the actual workflow in tripleo-common? i don't so. why?

AFAIU, the way it works right now is that we roughly have one message per workflow. The client is waiting for one message after starting a workflow, to get the end of the workflow. I wonder if having a message not consumed could break things?

Though I guess we only do websocket subscription, so it's only relevant if we have parallel workflows."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-09-26 20:57:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > You still need to change the workflow to not publish to zaqar,
 > > > right?
 > >
 > > you mean the actual workflow in tripleo-common? i don't so. why?
 > 
 > AFAIU, the way it works right now is that we roughly have one
 > message per workflow. The client is waiting for one message after
 > starting a workflow, to get the end of the workflow. I wonder if
 > having a message not consumed could break things?
 > 
 > Though I guess we only do websocket subscription, so it's only
 > relevant if we have parallel workflows.

well, with this patch, i'm not even going through the workflow any longer, so there will be no messages at all. i'm basically just decided to side-step the issue.

with the added benefit that calling the action syncrhonously is actually much faster than starting the workflow than polling for the result. and we get the needed result directly in the action output."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-26 21:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> well, with this patch, i'm not even going through the workflow any
 > longer, so there will be no messages at all. i'm basically just
 > decided to side-step the issue.

Oh, of course you run the action, not the workflow, sorry.
 
 > with the added benefit that calling the action syncrhonously is
 > actually much faster than starting the workflow than polling for
 > the result. and we get the needed result directly in the action
 > output.

Sync actions are not super scalable with Mistral. I think it's probably safe in this case, especially since it's just basically reading a file, but it's not a generic solution we can apply everywhere. Also, with websocket we don't poll"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-09-27 11:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-27 12:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2018-10-16 08:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-19 22:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-21 13:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit a57bd4868d1b9399aa4f61870f40ea412069ebd1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 12:31:07.000000000', 'message': 'Use sync action get_deployment_failures

Instead of using the workflow, which has the extra overhead of opening a
websocket and polling for messages and the workflow result, just use the
mistral action for get_deployment_failures directly. This is much
simpler.

It also fixes a bug where messages from other running workflows using
the same "tripleo" queue were polluting the output of the "overcloud
failures" command.

Change-Id: Ie774a5698515ba7e43dc0755042fb476eb241fc7
Closes-Bug: #1794277

commit_message:
Use sync action get_deployment_failures

Instead of using the workflow, which has the extra overhead of opening a
websocket and polling for messages and the workflow result, just use the
mistral action for get_deployment_failures directly. This is much
simpler.

It also fixes a bug where messages from other running workflows using
the same "tripleo" queue were polluting the output of the "overcloud
failures" command.

Change-Id: Ie774a5698515ba7e43dc0755042fb476eb241fc7
Closes-Bug: #1794277

[{'created': '2018-10-17 19:42:50.000000000', 'message': "Skip deployments with no uuid

If a deployment is not triggered for whatever stack operation is in
progress, instead of having a uuid for the deployment value, Heat just
substitutes the resource name of TripleOSoftwareDeployment.

This needs to be handled in the config download code so that we don't
try and query the Heat API for a deployment with that name which will
just result in a 404 Not found.

commit_message:
Skip deployments with no uuid

If a deployment is not triggered for whatever stack operation is in
progress, instead of having a uuid for the deployment value, Heat just
substitutes the resource name of TripleOSoftwareDeployment.

This needs to be handled in the config download code so that we don't
try and query the Heat API for a deployment with that name which will
just result in a 404 Not found.

Change-Id: If4575498387e9dee94a9ebd75353a2a8bf719072
Closes-Bug: #1798439

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 20:15:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't add tarball to config-download dir

GitPyton's repo.index.add defaults to force adding all ignored file
patterns from .gitignore. This was causing the generated
overcloud-config.tar.gz to also be included in the git repo. This caused
the config-download directory to recursivley grow larger in size as each
commit contained a tarball of the whole repo.

Using repo.git.add instead allows the .gitignore to be honored so that
the tarball isn't included in any commits.

Change-Id: I5c7b4fc448d957e30c0ea386795c9b698e9febed
Closes-Bug: #1795949
"}]
commit_message:
Don't add tarball to config-download dir

GitPyton's repo.index.add defaults to force adding all ignored file
patterns from .gitignore. This was causing the generated
overcloud-config.tar.gz to also be included in the git repo. This caused
the config-download directory to recursivley grow larger in size as each
commit contained a tarball of the whole repo.

Using repo.git.add instead allows the .gitignore to be honored so that
the tarball isn't included in any commits.

Change-Id: I5c7b4fc448d957e30c0ea386795c9b698e9febed
Closes-Bug: #1795949

commit_message:
make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

Change-Id: I437fde40345af52483cc764e5dc6a1f55f1b3e88

commit_message:
Gates: Update fluent-logging/elasticsearch configurations

This updates the fluentd buffer output configurations to account
for the restraints of the jobs deploying fluentd. This also
renames the fluentd configuration key from td_agent to fluentd to
reflect the fact we're no longer deploying td-agent

This also updates the Elasticsearch default replicas and overrides
the replica counts in each Elasticsearch deployment to account for
resource constraints

Change-Id: I55dee410eced99c3e1645f7452e4306ad646e601

I know it's a WIP patch, so I shouldn't review, but I have both positive points and concerns here.

1) I like the separation in folders based on use cases, like osh-infra-logging
2) I think we can break out things further in infra.
3) I think we should not remove the documentation, nor remove the convenience scripts for deploying ceph here.

Assuming we move things around, I imagine folders as "scenarios", like it is currently explained in the documentation.

Each scenario of "osh-INFRA" should take care of a basic infrastructure scenario IMO.

So we could multiply the amount of jobs, with dependencies if need be, each of those being a "small bit".
What do you think of having different folders for different stories, and those stories could be
1) k8s+ceph deployment
2) k8s+nfs deployment
3) k8s+LMA deployment without ceph or nfs (if that's possible)

'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 16:30:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Organize aio gates by function

This organizes the single node gates for osh-infra by function.
This organization aims to improve the single node gates in the
following ways:

1. Reduce number of services deployed in single node jobs
2. Only deploy Ceph for logging job, as Elasticsearch requires
   RGW for snapshot repositories.
3. Use NFS for storage for monitoring job, as Ceph is not a
   requirement for any of the services here.
4. Remove duplicate services deployed to multiple single node jobs
5. Remove storage from openstack-support job, as the only service
   requiring storage is rabbitmq. Rabbitmq is deployed with
   storage enabled in the openstack-helm checks/gates.

This also removes the documentation for the single node deployments,
as those deployments do not make sense with this change. This should
be revisited as a follow-on once we have a clear path forward for
the larger gate refactoring work

Change-Id: I46951f76904fa2ab245a202d55f76019b7503362
'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 18:46:37.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Organize aio gates by function

This organization aims to improve the single node gates in the
following ways:

1. Reduce number of services deployed in single node jobs
2. Only deploy Ceph for logging job, as Elasticsearch requires
   RGW for snapshot repositories.
3. Use NFS for storage for monitoring job, as Ceph is not a

4. Remove duplicate services deployed to multiple single node jobs
5. Remove storage from openstack-support job, as the only service
   requiring storage is rabbitmq. Rabbitmq is deployed with
   storage enabled in the openstack-helm checks/gates.

This also removes the documentation for the single node deployments,
as those deployments do not make sense with this change. This should
be revisited as a follow-on once we have a clear path forward for
the larger gate refactoring work

commit_message:
Organize aio gates by function

This organizes the single node gates for osh-infra by function.
This organization aims to improve the single node gates in the
following ways:

1. Reduce number of services deployed in single node jobs
2. Only deploy Ceph for logging job, as Elasticsearch requires
   RGW for snapshot repositories.
3. Use NFS for storage for monitoring job, as Ceph is not a
   requirement for any of the services here.
4. Remove duplicate services deployed to multiple single node jobs
5. Remove storage from openstack-support job, as the only service
   requiring storage is rabbitmq. Rabbitmq is deployed with
   storage enabled in the openstack-helm checks/gates.

This also removes the documentation for the single node deployments,
as those deployments do not make sense with this change. This should
be revisited as a follow-on once we have a clear path forward for
the larger gate refactoring work

Change-Id: I46951f76904fa2ab245a202d55f76019b7503362

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 10:23:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix changing user's own password

The original code is monkey-patching keystoneclient object to add a
user_id attribute to it. This no longer works with more recent
versions of keystoneclient, as they wrap the client in a helper
class.

I'm not happy with this solution, it's likely to have side effects
and to break again. I'm putting it up for discussion for a better
solution.

Change-Id: Idb296d1b10fa02a0b4852e96fe8cb2bdd70380e0
Closes-bug: #1776678
"}]
commit_message:
Fix changing user's own password

The original code is monkey-patching keystoneclient object to add a
user_id attribute to it. This no longer works with more recent
versions of keystoneclient, as they wrap the client in a helper
class.

I'm not happy with this solution, it's likely to have side effects
and to break again. I'm putting it up for discussion for a better
solution.

Change-Id: Idb296d1b10fa02a0b4852e96fe8cb2bdd70380e0
Closes-bug: #1776678

commit_message:
Set report_discard_supported to true for the RBD Cinder backend.

This enables Ceph discard/trim support with cinder volumes.
Note: that you still need to use a paravirtualized storage backend that 
supports discard/trim (virtio-scsi for example).

Change-Id: I7d564ac22ee8faedda0336ee5c67f8312c9f7d06

commit_message:
Add RBD-NBD support to openstack-helm

By default use rbd-nbd (librbd) instead of krbd.

Applying this change on existing nodes will
require reboots.

Change-Id: I81829fb8666541e856ab402128a5192984b6fe05

Considering ipxe is an enhancement to pxe, I wonder if it would be easier when we subclass iPXEBoot from PXEBoot. During deprecation window, we can load iPXEBoot underground when pxe +  ipxe_enabled is in use, and remove this support in T cycle.

I feel it would make deprecation easier, and also remove some duplicated codes.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Considering ipxe is an enhancement to pxe, I wonder if it would be
 > easier when we subclass iPXEBoot from PXEBoot. During deprecation
 > window, we can load iPXEBoot underground when pxe +  ipxe_enabled
 > is in use, and remove this support in T cycle.
 > 
 > I feel it would make deprecation easier, and also remove some
 > duplicated codes.

I originally did that, but ran into some issues with python2 and it felt cleaner to just go ahead and do the top level interface work upfront.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-09 13:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

Removing procedural -2 as the master branch is now open for Stein.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-09 14:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-08-09 14:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)

The most of the code of PXEBoot is common to iPXEBoot. May be instead of duplicating the entire code in iPXEBoot, we can move the common code to a new class say PXEBootCommon and then use it in PXEBoot and iPXEBoot classes. Also iPXEBoot needs to support boot with 'ramdisk' deploy interface."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-09-03 07:32:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

-1 is for the absence of support for 'ramdisk' deploy in 'ipxe' boot interface."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-05 19:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

> (6 comments)
 > 
 > The most of the code of PXEBoot is common to iPXEBoot. May be
 > instead of duplicating the entire code in iPXEBoot, we can move the
 > common code to a new class say PXEBootCommon and then use it in
 > PXEBoot and iPXEBoot classes. Also iPXEBoot needs to support boot
 > with 'ramdisk' deploy interface.

I completely agree. I think some of this actually also needs to end up in utils, but that can all be sorted out as time goes on. My hope is to iterate over this during this cycle slowly refactoring/cleaning it up"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-05 20:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I quite disagree with landing 1000+ lines of code without CI coverage. At least I cannot +2 it.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-25 02:44:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

> > I have a follow-up patch to change one of the jobs to explicitly
 > use the new interface. I believe that should be sufficient to get
 > started
 > 
 > I quite disagree with landing 1000+ lines of code without CI

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 22:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'ipxe boot interface - begin the process

A long time ago, in a galaxy not so far away,
the ironic comunity reached consensus that we
should refactor the PXE interface such that we
had separate PXE and iPXE interfaces.

In looking at what it would take for something like
a standalone deployment to have multiarchitecture
support in their environment, it seems even more
urgent and necessary that we begin to make this
delineation. This is because while some ARM iPXE
support exists, the binary is not a commonly
shipped artifiact, so operators are largely
only left with grubaa64.efi as their bootloader.

A similar issue exists with Power9 deployments
where they must disable iPXE, as the Power9
hardware expects reading a syslinux compatible
file, similarlly no iPXE loader exists.

To start this effort, we need to promote iPXE
functionality to a dedicated interface,
and remove the necessity of setting the
[pxe]ipxe_enabled setting.

Next steps, beyond this patch, would be to
begin to tease out the common private method
code in the underlying PXE interface that both
the iPXE and PXE interfaces use, and appropriately
relocate and refactor that code as necesary.

During this process, we can create an [ipxe]
configuration section, and migrate settings.

Finally, once the deprecation cycle is complete,
we will be able to remove the ipxe logic with-in
the PXE interface. That being said, that removal
is likely in excess of a year away.

Change-Id: I392616417c48986e84e50a3ddc7567344bfe3571
Story: #1628069
Task: #10516
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 22:31:17.000000000', 'message': 'ipxe boot interface - begin the process

functionality to a dedicated interface,
and remove the necessity of setting the
[pxe]ipxe_enabled setting.

Next steps, beyond this patch, would be to
begin to tease out the common private method
code in the underlying PXE interface that both
the iPXE and PXE interfaces use, and appropriately
relocate and refactor that code as necesary.

During this process, we can create an [ipxe]
configuration section, and migrate settings.

Finally, once the deprecation cycle is complete,
we will be able to remove the ipxe logic with-in
the PXE interface.

Change-Id: I392616417c48986e84e50a3ddc7567344bfe3571
Story: #1628069
Task: #10516
'}, {'created': '2018-09-26 14:09:01.000000000', 'message': 'ipxe boot interface

A long time ago, in a galaxy not so far away,
the ironic comunity reached consensus that we
should refactor the PXE interface such that we
had separate PXE and iPXE interfaces.

In looking at what it would take for something like
a standalone deployment to have multiarchitecture
support in their environment, it seems even more
urgent and necessary that we begin to make this
delineation. This is because while some ARM iPXE
support exists, the binary is not a commonly
shipped artifiact, so operators are largely
only left with grubaa64.efi as their bootloader.

A similar issue exists with ppc64le deployments
where they must disable iPXE, as the ppc64le
hardware expects reading a syslinux compatible
file, similarlly no iPXE loader exists.

To start this effort, we need to promote iPXE
functionality to a dedicated interface,
and remove the necessity of setting the
[pxe]ipxe_enabled setting.

begin to tease out the common private method

commit_message:
ipxe boot interface

A long time ago, in a galaxy not so far away,
the ironic comunity reached consensus that we
should refactor the PXE interface such that we
had separate PXE and iPXE interfaces.

In looking at what it would take for something like
a standalone deployment to have multiarchitecture
support in their environment, it seems even more
urgent and necessary that we begin to make this
delineation. This is because while some ARM iPXE
support exists, the binary is not a commonly
shipped artifiact, so operators are largely
only left with grubaa64.efi as their bootloader.

A similar issue exists with ppc64le deployments
where they must disable iPXE, as the ppc64le
hardware expects reading a syslinux compatible
file, similarlly no iPXE loader exists.

To start this effort, we need to promote iPXE
functionality to a dedicated interface,
and remove the necessity of setting the
[pxe]ipxe_enabled setting.

Next steps, beyond this patch, would be to
begin to tease out the common private method
code in the underlying PXE interface that both
the iPXE and PXE interfaces use, and appropriately
relocate and refactor that code as necesary.

During this process, we can create an [ipxe]
configuration section, and migrate settings.

Finally, once the deprecation cycle is complete,
we will be able to remove the ipxe logic with-in
the PXE interface.

Change-Id: I392616417c48986e84e50a3ddc7567344bfe3571
Story: #1628069
Task: #10516

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 21:25:52.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ia7e151422b69f8dc8b0bd0f05eb72343f1221520
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ia7e151422b69f8dc8b0bd0f05eb72343f1221520

commit_message:
Set the version of SQLAlchemy-Utils to 0.33.5

SQLAlchemy-Utils version 0.33.6 was released a few days ago, and it blocks vitrage gate.
We should keep using version 0.33.5.

[{'created': '2018-10-19 15:21:00.000000000', 'message': 'Switch OpenShiftGlusterDisks to a single disk

According to docs[1] the minimum requirements when deploying Gluster are:
 - at least one raw block device to be used for Gluster storage
 - minimum of 3 nodes

This change adjusts the defaults that we set in THT to use one disk for
Gluster storage instead of 3.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.10/install/prerequisites.html#hardware-glusterfs

Change-Id: Iab068a18ac9bce79824f5b7edb4a2931f5b66638
'}]
commit_message:
Switch OpenShiftGlusterDisks to a single disk

According to docs[1] the minimum requirements when deploying Gluster are:
 - at least one raw block device to be used for Gluster storage
 - minimum of 3 nodes

This change adjusts the defaults that we set in THT to use one disk for
Gluster storage instead of 3.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.10/install/prerequisites.html#hardware-glusterfs

Change-Id: Iab068a18ac9bce79824f5b7edb4a2931f5b66638

subject: Make system_crontab_coordination idempotent
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-20 08:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-20 09:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-10-20 20:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-20 08:13:02.000000000', 'message': "Make system_crontab_coordination idempotent

Use a seed in the system_crontab_coordination role template's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I283f7562adf5984498ad712cf030bbb21a0e6a9c
(cherry picked from commit 953938a29de8a52309aaae69c6c16fbcefcb7b52)
"}]
commit_message:
Make system_crontab_coordination idempotent

Use a seed in the system_crontab_coordination role template's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I283f7562adf5984498ad712cf030bbb21a0e6a9c
(cherry picked from commit 953938a29de8a52309aaae69c6c16fbcefcb7b52)

commit_message:
Name unnamed tasks

These tasks had an empty name field, which breaks ansible's
--start-at-task functionality with a traceback, as it's not valid to
have unnamed tasks.

Change-Id: I2386da62a87bfc290070fce13c2d35290565478a

[{'created': '2018-09-17 23:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'check mode: paunch configs

Adds check mode support for the paunch container startup configuration
files. During check mode, the files are written under
/var/lib/tripleo-config/check-mode and then diffed with the existing
versions under /var/lib/tripleo-config.

In a similar fashion, the kolla config files are written under
/var/lib/kolla/config_files/check-mode and then diffed with their
existing versions.

Change-Id: I9add7b9fda50847c111e91735bd55a1ddf32f696

commit_message:
check mode: paunch configs

Adds initial check mode support for the paunch container startup
configuration and kolla config files. This cleans up the formatting of
the generated files so that the diff shown duing check mode with --diff
is useful.

We can't actually run paunch during check mode as it doesn't yet have
any support for a dry run mode.

Change-Id: I9add7b9fda50847c111e91735bd55a1ddf32f696

[{'created': '2018-09-17 23:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'check mode: docker_puppet_tasks

Adds check mode support for docker_puppet_tasks. Writes the updated task
files at
/var/lib/docker-puppet/check-mode/docker-puppet-tasks{{step}}.json
during check mode. The updated file for each step is then diffed with
the existing file for that step to report on any differences.

Change-Id: I19e8bc9eb93d8acc8ee7d737770f9cc7e63f7a27
'}, {'created': '2018-09-18 12:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'check mode: docker_puppet_tasks

files at

'}, {'created': '2018-09-19 18:46:30.000000000', 'message': "check mode: docker_puppet_tasks

Adds check mode support for docker_puppet_tasks.

Since it's not possible to reliably determine what these tasks do, we
can't actually run them to get an idea of what might be changed. We can
however show the diff of the json file to get an idea of what would be
run.

commit_message:
check mode: docker_puppet_tasks

Adds check mode support for docker_puppet_tasks.

Since it's not possible to reliably determine what these tasks do, we
can't actually run them to get an idea of what might be changed. We can
however show the diff of the json file to get an idea of what would be
run.

Change-Id: I19e8bc9eb93d8acc8ee7d737770f9cc7e63f7a27

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 15:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX: set faked max_oversubscription_ratio

FakeConfiguration is used in VMAX tests. Without a valueset for
max_oversubscription_ratio, this results in test failures with the
error:

"TypeError: float() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'"

This adds a default value for this config option in the fake config.

Change-Id: Ia0b9772823fe9d093cfafe3ee241aad5b21fc3fd

commit_message:
VMAX: set faked max_oversubscription_ratio

FakeConfiguration is used in VMAX tests. Without a valueset for
max_oversubscription_ratio, this results in test failures with the
error:

"TypeError: float() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'"

This adds a default value for this config option in the fake config.

Change-Id: Ia0b9772823fe9d093cfafe3ee241aad5b21fc3fd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
MariaDB: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

subject: gerritbot: Change x-vrif-minus-2 to x-verified-minus-2
messages:
[{'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-17 20:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-17 20:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-17 20:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-18 13:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

what is the order for these to merge?

what will happen if this is merged and the gerritbot change not? will gerritbot fail to parse?

What happens if gerritbot change merges and this not? Will gerritbot fail?

I would like to have compatibility so that the gerritbot change merges first, gets deployed and then this one. Please add a depends-on dependency on the gerritbot one.

This also means: gerritbot needs to parse the current syntax.

Change itself is fine but I have my doubts that it will not break anything, thus giving WIP and waiting for comments.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-18 16:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> what is the order for these to merge?

From my testing it does not matter. Things work either way.

 > what will happen if this is merged and the gerritbot change not?
 > will gerritbot fail to parse?

Not in my testing. gerritbot does not have a list of allowed events. It just adds any events it sees to the dict and the channel they were found for. https://github.com/openstack-infra/gerritbot/blob/4658934d2239c32103c0e04cb32e2af4d44c16f4/gerritbot/bot.py#L376-L379

The x-vrif/crvw-* parsing is done here:
https://github.com/openstack-infra/gerritbot/blob/4658934d2239c32103c0e04cb32e2af4d44c16f4/gerritbot/bot.py#L217-L256

And that uses dict.get() calls. So no breakage there.

 > What happens if gerritbot change merges and this not? Will
 > gerritbot fail?

Also no issues from my testing.

 > I would like to have compatibility so that the gerritbot change
 > merges first, gets deployed and then this one. Please add a
 > depends-on dependency on the gerritbot one.

I can do that. 

 > This also means: gerritbot needs to parse the current syntax.

It does.

 > Change itself is fine but I have my doubts that it will not break
 > anything, thus giving WIP and waiting for comments.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-18 16:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-18 16:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-18 16:27:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Let's also update https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#configure-gerritbot-to-announce-changes - repo is openstack-infra/infra-manual"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-18 17:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck - timeout'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Patchset 5 was an accident :( So took patchset 4 and rebased it to become patchset 6.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-20 17:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-20 17:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The dependency is most likely never going to merge - and if it does, this needs updating. Let's remove for now since it's stale and in merge-conflict."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 20:35:14.000000000', 'message': "gerritbot: Change x-vrif-minus-2 to x-verify-minus-2

Currently support for the event x-vrif-minus-2 is broken in
openstack-infra/gerritbot. A patch is proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/545502 to resolve this issue. Along with
resolving the issue it has renamed the event names to be more obvious
and understandable.

The event names have been changed as follows:

      * x-vrif-plus-2   -> x-verified-plus-2
      * x-vrif-minus-2  -> x-verified-minus-2
      * x-crvw-plus-2   -> x-codereview-plus-2
      * x-crvw-minus-2  -> x-codereview-minus-2

Only the event name 'x-vrif-minus-2' was used in channels.yaml. None
of the other x-* events are being used.

Update tools/irc_tests.py to accept the following events:
      * x-verified-minus-2
      * x-codereview-minus-2

Change-Id: Ibc9b4b2d171461b300619c17ff0ee97b1327d444

commit_message:
gerritbot: Change x-vrif-minus-2 to x-verified-minus-2

Currently support for the event x-vrif-minus-2 is broken in
openstack-infra/gerritbot. A patch is proposed [1] to resolve this
issue. Along with resolving the issue it has renamed the event names
to be more obvious and understandable.

The event names have been changed as follows:

      * x-vrif-plus-2   -> x-verified-plus-2
      * x-vrif-minus-2  -> x-verified-minus-2
      * x-crvw-plus-2   -> x-codereview-plus-2
      * x-crvw-minus-2  -> x-codereview-minus-2

Only the event name 'x-vrif-minus-2' was used in channels.yaml. None
of the other x-* events are being used.

Update tools/irc_tests.py to accept the following events:
      * x-verified-minus-2
      * x-codereview-minus-2

[1] openstack-infra/gerritbot: I3b4e67bdac69ea0ff4d48dd81a35f045d7ddcef3
    https://review.openstack.org/545502

Depends-On: I3b4e67bdac69ea0ff4d48dd81a35f045d7ddcef3
Change-Id: Ibc9b4b2d171461b300619c17ff0ee97b1327d444

the openstack-python-jobs adds a post job as well, so remove it - and let's add to commit message that now all these projects get one.

I think the change is fine then - but not a simple refactor anymore."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-03 21:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mohammed, how do you want to continue here?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-20 17:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

no followup since nearly a year. Feel free to restore, address comments and rebase.'}]

ElasticSearch: Clean endpoints

This PS removes the unused 'public' endpoint and renames the
'default' endpoint to 'logging' reflecting its usage.

Change-Id: I467264c68d73de9977151ce0f17f603ac8447406

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 03:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.6

inventory_hostname is not reliable to be used as container_name. When
delegating in 2.6+, the inventory_hostname of the delegating host is
passed to the connection plugin, additionally when a host doesn't have
its own container_name variable a cached inventory_hostname is used in
its place.

To get the connection plugin working with Ansible 2.6 this change
essentially allows the container_check to fall through when delegating
to physical hosts or hosts not in the inventory by:
- removing inventory_hostname as a fallback for container_name
- unsetting container_name when delegating to a known physical host
- unsetting container_name when delegating to a host not mentioned in
  the inventory

container_name can no longer be used as a group variable based on
inventory_hostname, it will need to be an inventory/host variable for
each individual host.

Also, when container_user is used the remote_tmp path needs to be set to
a system writable directory instead of the root user's home.

Change-Id: If2eb4c16273e19599f6ec3f0cba6b3573912c6a0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.6

inventory_hostname is not reliable to be used as container_name. When
delegating in 2.6+, the inventory_hostname of the delegating host is
passed to the connection plugin, additionally when a host doesn't have
its own container_name variable a cached inventory_hostname is used in
its place.

To get the connection plugin working with Ansible 2.6 this change
essentially allows the container_check to fall through when delegating
to physical hosts or hosts not in the inventory by:
- removing inventory_hostname as a fallback for container_name
- unsetting container_name when delegating to a known physical host
- unsetting container_name when delegating to a host not mentioned in
  the inventory

container_name can no longer be used as a group variable based on
inventory_hostname, it will need to be an inventory/host variable for
each individual host.

Also, when container_user is used the remote_tmp path needs to be set to
a system writable directory instead of the root user's home.

Change-Id: If2eb4c16273e19599f6ec3f0cba6b3573912c6a0

commit_message:
Use volume_uuid in _resize_share of Quobyte Driver

Adds resolving the volume name to volume id when resizing
and cleans up _resolve_volume_name calls.

Closes-Bug: #1774604

Change-Id: I37ecd611c94f9b0019b87d5186f96aed93130f88
(cherry picked from commit ff55def55b490a16f570265265fa90a29f2c3145)
(cherry picked from commit e7d976faa2ef82af035f05f71cb9b9afef93c540)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 16:55:41.000000000', 'message': "Add `--force` to `docker rm` in DevStack plugin

Seems like CentOS gate sometimes fails on plugin.sh:extract_hyperkube
with:

  Error response from daemon: You cannot remove a running container
  <id>. Stop the container before attempting removal or force remove

Let's listen to the log message and add `--force` to that `docker rm`.

Change-Id: Ia0891d074e0b4c5870ec67f1f4459e8c7110aebd
"}]
commit_message:
Add `--force` to `docker rm` in DevStack plugin

Seems like CentOS gate sometimes fails on plugin.sh:extract_hyperkube
with:

  Error response from daemon: You cannot remove a running container
  <id>. Stop the container before attempting removal or force remove

Let's listen to the log message and add `--force` to that `docker rm`.

Change-Id: Ia0891d074e0b4c5870ec67f1f4459e8c7110aebd

commit_message:
After run manila tempest the share network residue

After run manila tempest with multi-tenancy, there have
manila share network residue. This manila share network
should be deleted in clear resources.

Change-Id: Ifedc595f8c0c754355861f25f1b6af9353d644f8
Closes-Bug:#1754588
(cherry picked from commit 01c7feed86db36d0ea11ec3db75aae15a62baee8)
(cherry picked from commit 608a0450b29adaeaeb398782f7bab9b8735ead12)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 06:12:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update tasks for openshift

While introducing the openshift-node service in 7373adc72e, some code
was moved around and that broke the OpenShift external_deploy_task
playbook in the case of a stack update due to undefined ansible
variable.

Rename the new_masters var into new_master_nodes and introduce the
has_new_nodes boolean var that indicates there is at least one new node
in the deployment.

Related-Bug: 1794824

Change-Id: I2f386b5507836deda0816616dd7add8a0b53dfd3
(cherry picked from commit 73c3cd41813606cd715c9193d825d64dcf2c3b40)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update tasks for openshift

While introducing the openshift-node service in 7373adc72e, some code
was moved around and that broke the OpenShift external_deploy_task
playbook in the case of a stack update due to undefined ansible
variable.

Rename the new_masters var into new_master_nodes and introduce the
has_new_nodes boolean var that indicates there is at least one new node
in the deployment.

Related-Bug: 1794824

Change-Id: I2f386b5507836deda0816616dd7add8a0b53dfd3
(cherry picked from commit 73c3cd41813606cd715c9193d825d64dcf2c3b40)

commit_message:
Use openshift-ansible container instead of RPMs

This allows us to deploy openshift without the need to install
openshift-ansible in the mistral container image or in the undercloud.

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ied75bfbeed71aca83962e60bfc801a2527f5dfba
Change-Id: I1e28e63c8a3a30dfe1e95924f9b4086fcf9513fb
(cherry picked from commit a4b31b28e9bff585ed1842b7ea266666c0fb4542)

commit_message:
Enhanced checksum support

Adds enhanced checksum support to IPA, when os_hash_algo and os_hash_value
are passed in via image_info, it will be used to calculate image checksum
and verification.

In other cases, the old md5 checksum is used.

Change-Id: I1d2f33e7059910326b4ac3f7786543b333a93a5a
Story: 2003938
Task: 26846

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 13:06:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
"}, {'created': '2018-10-19 13:23:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571
"}]
commit_message:
Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571

commit_message:
Create tempest networks for standalone

* In order to run full tempest tests, we need a public network which
  can be consumed by tempest tests in order to run full tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ib643dba40efa49095715fcf17f93894ebc8cdea9

commit_message:
Add specific tempest tests for puppet project

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609300/ adds the support of using
tripleo-standalone job to gate puppet projects. It adds the list
of tempest tests which can be triggered against specific projects
in order to perform the sanity of the patches.

Change-Id: I99d50c0347fae273a85cd9dcab29006d985b86a0

commit_message:
Move cinder-manage page to cli doc subtree

Since we have a CLI reference and specific doc subtree the
cinder-manage docs should live there. This moves the cinder-manage
page from man/ to cli/ and adds a redirect link.

Change-Id: If99416e8a382d2a6571412742276dccc591d180c

Add IdentityService version ('v3') in initialization.

Added endpoint_filter in requests of Project and Domain.

Story: 2002115
Change-Id: I7accd67d9e07af408d22a1b628082c5ef2ba1f99

commit_message:
Add wrapper for openshift-ansible docker command

This should permit running the openshift-ansible docker image installer
from within the mistral container.

Change-Id: Ied75bfbeed71aca83962e60bfc801a2527f5dfba
(cherry picked from commit a2029198c2a1979442510efc41fd440be320feec)

commit_message:
Add documentation for soft power for ilo hardware type

This patch updates documentation of 'ilo' hardware type for
soft power functionality.

Change-Id: I644ddf627effcb136bfa83929769da690f11470b

commit_message:
Add validations for OneView ML2 driver

The patch adds two more validations to OneView hardware
type when using the OneView ML2 driver. This also adds
a new flag, `use_oneview_ml2_driver`, in driver_info
to check if the OneView ML2 driver is being used.

Closes-Bug: 1720830
Change-Id: I9b409a83aa483727462a59341773414aa8cd02f8

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:00.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I9e2283861029ae34dac0a15fc1b24ea03b55a47f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I9e2283861029ae34dac0a15fc1b24ea03b55a47f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow update request with current segment_id

If the segment_id in the update request equals the segment_id
already associated with the subnet being updated, there is no
need for further update related segment validations.

Closes-Bug: #1793391
Change-Id: I65cd5b92b219c14dd07ae72457af243756c4ed02

commit_message:
Validate routed networks enabled if multiple subnets in conf

Add's a validation to undercloud preflight checks to ensure
eneble_routed_networks is True when multiple subnets is defined
in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: I48ea4d70bf79c622f037469fa6d82eea7524b835
Closes-Bug: #1791034

commit_message:
Make system_crontab_coordination idempotent

Use a seed in the system_crontab_coordination role template's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I283f7562adf5984498ad712cf030bbb21a0e6a9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 13:10:38.000000000', 'message': 'Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6
'}]
commit_message:
Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I2ff8b26ab8fb81f444682e9e9a53c0ecba97d7eb

commit_message:
Honor blacklist during temp key injection

The server blacklist also needs to be honored when getting the list
of hosts that we use to check for the ssh port being available, and
injecting the temporary ssh key.

Change-Id: I7ea9201f39af17bb43b7a1b8a9d8d1064e365c14
Closes-Bug: #1797572
(cherry picked from commit 7cef36bc9bf9ab23643116ae3bcea588882f5f26)

commit_message:
Add a guard to break if no connection

If the WebSocket connection is already disconnected we don't have to
wait for messages

Change-Id: I7543c8e61711f036140db20416a57447da6c4c18
Closes-Bug: #1793264
(cherry picked from commit 99b7a3d1d15813fd8d07aa36636feb44516dc523)

commit_message:
Recreate cinder LVM loopback device on startup

Add a systemd service that creates the loopback device required by
cinder's iSCSI backend on system startup.

This patch also consolidates the host_prep_tasks for the HA and non-HA
versions of the cinder-volume service. The list of tasks is identical,
and rather than repeating it in each template, the tasks are defined
once in cinder-common.yaml.

Closes-Bug: #1581092
Change-Id: Icc04003a9e90b66720d968c6c8f1c687156b677e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 07:16:57.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Remove restart_flag leftovers for bundles

Since the introduction of I62870c055097569ceab2ff67cf0fe63122277c5b
"Introduce restart_bundle containers to detect config changes and
restart pacemaker resources" we actually use paunch to detect any
config changes (by verifying an md5 hash over the generated config
files of the service).

With this new way of detecting changes there is no need to use the
old 'tripleo::pacemaker::resource_restart_flag' method to restart
pcmk services.

Let's just remove this unused code.

Change-Id: Ib12dbe66575e3d54a8ec7d2c72c2b4619bc39b03
'}, {'created': '2018-10-05 11:56:22.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Remove restart_flag leftovers for bundles

Since the introduction of I62870c055097569ceab2ff67cf0fe63122277c5b
"Introduce restart_bundle containers to detect config changes and
restart pacemaker resources" we actually use paunch to detect any
config changes (by verifying an md5 hash over the generated config
files of the service).

With this new way of detecting changes there is no need to use the
old 'tripleo::pacemaker::resource_restart_flag' method to restart
pcmk services.

Let's just remove this unused code.

commit_message:
Remove restart_flag leftovers for bundles

Since the introduction of I62870c055097569ceab2ff67cf0fe63122277c5b
"Introduce restart_bundle containers to detect config changes and
restart pacemaker resources" we actually use paunch to detect any
config changes (by verifying an md5 hash over the generated config
files of the service).

With this new way of detecting changes there is no need to use the
old 'tripleo::pacemaker::resource_restart_flag' method to restart
pcmk services.

Let's just remove this unused code.

Change-Id: Ib12dbe66575e3d54a8ec7d2c72c2b4619bc39b03

commit_message:
Do not create metadata ssl proxy if we have metadata api via httpd wsgi

With nova metadata api running via wsgi we do not need the ssl proxy when
configure tls-everywhere as we terminate ssl direct in the httpd wsgi.
With this change we only create the ssl proxy vhost if we do not run nova
metadata via wsgi.

Related-Bug: 1781405

Change-Id: Ia0e769925812e91679631bdd631030ab12ceff01
(cherry picked from commit a8bef7a3135d295e667e2e80a2e23e3515a0cb88)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iee9939776d5552b818aec5cab0b8c2a1133f74b9
(cherry picked from commit 40f4a6b282757d7dd9ebd60de0c4cfbeccfcb16f)

http://logs.openstack.org/31/607831/3/check/openstack-tox-py27/788bea9/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-10-10_12_24_37_035601"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-10-11 03:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add python 3.6 for test in tox

This commit adds support for py36 in tox.ini by default. When tox
command is executed by developer it will run py36 tests.

Change-Id: I2363435eaab88ff2a67146c7239404518173c599

commit_message:
Remove some less necessary check jobs

In order to lighten the infra load, especially in
light of recent persistent backlog, this patch
proposes to remove several less essential jobs.

Removed check jobs:
- congress-devstack-api-postgresql
- congress-pe-replicated-mysql

because all issues should be apparent from the
remaining jobs:
- congress-devstack-api-mysql
- congress-pe-replicated-postgresql

Also temporarily disabling the tripleO jobs until the
quicker single-node jobs are available.

See tripleO announcement for more info:
https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg123863.html

Change-Id: Iaaeffff20d28e550603af4d1059c8ff1662adec7

[{'created': '2018-10-17 06:42:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix bash cmd used in scenario trunk tests

In scenario trunk test test_subport_connectivity there
is bash command used to check name of base interface on
spawned vm (e.g. ens3 or eth0), configure vlan interface
with vlan_id used on trunk port (e.g. ens3.10),
make this vlan device up and run dhclient on this interface
if it's not running yet.

This command was broken and that cause failure of this test.

Change-Id: I4c0207f79cd6df2594f976b9509697209011edf2
Closes-Bug: #1766701
(cherry picked from commit 6bf840f0a73579804375dddd92b3a20acc57b877)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bash cmd used in scenario trunk tests

In scenario trunk test test_subport_connectivity there
is bash command used to check name of base interface on
spawned vm (e.g. ens3 or eth0), configure vlan interface
with vlan_id used on trunk port (e.g. ens3.10),
make this vlan device up and run dhclient on this interface
if it's not running yet.

This command was broken and that cause failure of this test.

Change-Id: I4c0207f79cd6df2594f976b9509697209011edf2
Closes-Bug: #1766701
(cherry picked from commit 6bf840f0a73579804375dddd92b3a20acc57b877)

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie0b56212cad8d9756c2043a4483c607101491a14

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iee9939776d5552b818aec5cab0b8c2a1133f74b9

commit_message:
Add iptables metadata marking rule on router init

Move the iptables metadata marking rule earlier in
router init, that way any stray metadata requests
that arrive before the filter metadata redirect rule is
installed will just be dropped.  We do this irregardless
of whether we will be running the metadata proxy.

Partial-bug: #1735724

Change-Id: I8982523dbb94a7c5b8a4db88a196fabc4dd2873f
(cherry picked from commit 69419778276a722c3f376046d1e0cc7fc4684e99)

commit_message:
overcloud-prep-images: use container_cli

In overcloud-prep-images, use container_cli instead of hardcoding
Docker.
We are working on supporting Podman, so we need this patch to be able to
deploy an Overcloud when Podman is deployed on the Undercloud.

Change-Id: I0e2156a6b97220d1e26015fe4aab5e2189be34ee

commit_message:
Apply variable to task not the block

- use static import of role since dynamic is not required
- apply variables to the task, not the block
- remove block since it does not appear to be necessary

Change-Id: I9cb0dd38c972ed0e81cbd7228490018d600eaa5c

'}]
commit_message:
Add conditions for allowing traffic for controllers

We need to use in allow-traffic-for-controller.yml the same conditionals
that we have in prep-network [1] otherwise the script to allow the
traffic will be executed and, since it expects to find the BOOTSTACK_MASQ
iptables chain, will fail.

[1] roles/overcloud-prep-network/templates/overcloud-prep-network.sh.j2

Change-Id: Ia104eecbe29c1eee230c2ccbc5926ca8bfbffc83

this seems like  agood idea. main reason i don't +2 is because i couldn't get it to work quickly (and want to go do other reviews now ;))"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Marios, in some cases you may need to do a "pre-commit install --install-hooks".

I think this may be needed if you cloned the project before it had the pre-commit adopted or something like this because it was not 
needed on all projects. For those that adopted it long time ago,
it did work for me without doing anything else.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-09-24 07:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

> Marios, in some cases you may need to do a "pre-commit install
 > --install-hooks".
 > 
 > I think this may be needed if you cloned the project before it had
 > the pre-commit adopted or something like this because it was not

yes now it works thanks! wondering where a good place to add a note is? Maybe the README though that is pretty sparse, anyway perhaps just a sentence about this pre-commit hook for devs.
Changes to be committed:
  (use "git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage)

	new file:   test.sh
	new file:   test.sh.j2

[m@192 tripleo-quickstart-extras]$ git commit -a
bashate..................................................................Failed
hookid: bashate

Running bashate on test.sh
test.sh:4:1: E001 Trailing Whitespace
1 bashate error(s) found'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-24 07:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Marios, I will document it but inside tripleo-docs to avoid having
to add extra documentation for each repository. But before writing
the doc I want to achieve a full implementation in one repository,
so I can give it as an example. By full I mean one that covers: commit message fixes, generifc line endings and white space rules, yaml, ansible-linting and pep8/flake8. This repository happens to be the
best candidate for these.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-16 17:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-16 23:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 15:09:45.000000000', 'message': 'Run bashate via pre-commit

Migrates bashate linting task to pre-commit in order to allow fast
and transparent execution before uploading changes to gerrit.

Other linters can be run as well, including flake8 and ansible-linter.
This also lowers the footprint on developer machines because each
linter/version is stored only once on disk, regardless how many
repositories are using it.

Only action needed for enabling pre-commit as a developer is to
run `pip install pre-commit`, everything else is done transparently
after.

Change-Id: I6ad834bbfbaf7645c542e4f922e89bc4449247c3

commit_message:
Run bashate via pre-commit

Migrates bashate linting task to pre-commit in order to allow fast
and transparent execution before uploading changes to gerrit.

Other linters can be run as well, including flake8 and ansible-linter.
This also lowers the footprint on developer machines because each
linter/version is stored only once on disk, regardless how many
repositories are using it.

Only action needed for enabling pre-commit as a developer is to
run `pip install pre-commit`, everything else is done transparently
after.

Partial-Bug: #1786286
Change-Id: I6ad834bbfbaf7645c542e4f922e89bc4449247c3

commit_message:
Add tempest workspace volume for tempest

* It also set proper setype for tempest service directories
This will allow proper access from the containers without any new SELinux policy.

* /var/lib/tempest will be used for creating tempest workspace.

Change-Id: Iedd397784c8b8d1bb891272542bd242c0ea60340

commit_message:
Apply variable to task not the block

- use static import of role since dynamic is not required
- apply variables to the task, not the block
- remove block since it does not appear to be necessary

Change-Id: I9cb0dd38c972ed0e81cbd7228490018d600eaa5c
(cherry picked from commit f6a6fb459ad830de3677f89777ca188aeee8972e)

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::Services::ContainerImagePrepare to ControllerOpenStack

This service was in Controller but not in ControllerOpenStack.
Prepare service which causes overcloud deployment fail due to missing
images.

Change-Id: I7e1ffd3a50714c825f4091d7c0aee2d895ad72a1
Closes-Bug: #1798670

commit_message:
Allow Ipv6 addresses for nova_metadata_host

Current logic didn't check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address
causing the proxy request to fail with an exception because the url is
not valid.

This patchs check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address and
create a valid url enclosing the IPv6 address with brackets

Closes-Bug: #1796593

Change-Id: Ibfebffcec2c8860237a1f151084de978a7863bd8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 85588ad38e3a08137f4f7b4be98ce271064eb2f0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 09:37:58.000000000', 'message': 'Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing becomes a mutual exclusive and
opted-out alternative to copytruncate.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP and drop their tasks in
progress on floor, copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We keep that option for
future in the hope things get fixed eventually.

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7a33fd7b65dc96df4189737a00d8a7050c36e75c)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 12:01:25.000000000', 'message': 'Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a3524108977777c7b171086fcd4f4a627d215cb3)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 12:51:03.000000000', 'message': "Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing goes away.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

Nor can we fall back to that predates the containerization of services
because of the following reasons:

* We cannot and should not use the restart command in postrotate as it
  was before containerization of services. For that a container needs
  to be privileged and granted a docker socket bind-mount, which is a
  total security antipattern and defeats the very purpose of
  containerization. Things may change with future adoption of Podman
  and/or kubelet control plane though. If/when that happens, we might
  consider an option for postrotate to terminate a process with
  SIGTERM, to have the process instantly respawned via its systemd
  unit/kubelet restart policies.

* Individual services' logrotate configs worth nothing, when still
  being handled by a central logrotation container running crond. And
  it needs to remain centralized as individual containers neither do
  run crond nor contain logrotate, nor lightweight containers following
  12-factors apps recommendations should do anything like that. Nor the
  host logrotate/crond can do rotation of logs for containers as we do/
  should not install required packages on the host, but only in
  containers. See also the spec [0] explaining the reasoning better.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We leave that option for
future implementation in the hope things get fixed eventually. As well
as the aforementioned systemd/kublet option, or the option to provide
stdout only logging [0] and let the logrotate thing go.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2b223de04b26210cc865c3f6061d8d139859f34c)
"}, {'created': '2018-10-19 08:07:36.000000000', 'message': "Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

commit_message:
Copytruncate containerized logrotate configuration

This reimplements commit 67a7dc70f2885b7db2a42bc28c25ece0bbeba3e4.
Copytruncate becomes a default for containerized logrotate. The
solution based on signals processing goes away.

As long as key deployment framework components heat-engine and
mistral-engine do not tolerate SIGHUP copytruncate should be used.

There is more openstack services, like neutron-server, nova-scheduler
that cannot handle SIGHUP nicely yet.

Nor can we fall back to that predates the containerization of services
because of the following reasons:

* We cannot and should not use the restart command in postrotate as it
  was before containerization of services. For that a container needs
  to be privileged and granted a docker socket bind-mount, which is a
  total security antipattern and defeats the very purpose of
  containerization. Things may change with future adoption of Podman
  and/or kubelet control plane though. If/when that happens, we might
  consider an option for postrotate to terminate a process with
  SIGTERM, to have the process instantly respawned via its systemd
  unit/kubelet restart policies.

* Individual services' logrotate configs worth nothing, when still
  being handled by a central logrotation container running crond. And
  it needs to remain centralized as individual containers neither do
  run crond nor contain logrotate, nor lightweight containers following
  12-factors apps recommendations should do anything like that. Nor the
  host logrotate/crond can do rotation of logs for containers as we do/
  should not install required packages on the host, but only in
  containers. See also the spec [0] explaining the reasoning better.

All of that makes copytruncate a global choice for logs rotation of
containerized services as we just cannont be sure, if a service foo
*really* does correct processing of SIGHUP. We leave that option for
future implementation in the hope things get fixed eventually. As well
as the aforementioned systemd/kublet option, or the option to provide
stdout only logging [0] and let the logrotate thing go.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/462900

Closes-Bug: #1795411
Related-Bug: #1276694
Change-Id: Ibdad7859a389d0ff37bbf7bfd9f4c521a05a5ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2b223de04b26210cc865c3f6061d8d139859f34c)

commit_message:
Replace RabbitMQ with OsloMessaging(Rpc|Notify)

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507963/ introduced
new services: OsloMessagingRpc and OsloMessagingNotify.
When performing upgrade we need to adjust custom roles_data file.
Also drop obsolete replacement for FluentdClient and
ManilaBackendGeneric.

Change-Id: Iec563245e07ed796bd4d1d0da4d0e4648c513797
(cherry picked from commit 8ca800a4839d9fcd097cb74580a31dffde61bfb3)

commit_message:
Add fedora28 standalone non-voting job definition

Allows us to progress with changes required
for enabling use of dnf and python3.

Change-Id: Ie94d5b1672bf54da3bb3787099bdc2f70ee67e6d

commit_message:
Remove "--os-identity-api-version" argument

Following commits:
  Change 608808
  Change 604284
  Use keystoneauth1.load.get_plugin_loader to load and discovery dynamically
without explicitly specifying V2 or V3 of keystone.

  The argument of "--os-identity-api-version" is no longer required.

Change-Id: Idbd324d30489ae3c6a279e7147387fea81f39063

commit_message:
api-ref: fix some inconsistencies in snapshot API

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#list-snapshots-and-details

1. updated_at is missing in the response fields of show-snapshot
   and list-snapshots
2. id's description is "The UUID of the volume transfer.", which
   is incorrect.
3. volume_id's description is "The UUID of the volume.", which is
   not very accurate.
4. os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress is something like '100%',
   so it should be string, not integer
5. response fields of show-snapshot-metadata is incorrect.
6. metadata is missing in the response example of update-snapshot
7. snapshots_links is missing in the response of list-snapshot

Change-Id: I0f6994c2d2dc27d3d594acdd460e27c338f86a2c

commit_message:
Cinder Backup: object_count value incorrect

Whenever we create a backup, the object_count value doesn't match
with the actual number of objects created.
This patch addresses the change.

Co-authored-by: wanghongxu <wang19930902@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I972df393fe64ca55fcdaa629f03cfc10761f0f24
Closes-Bug: #1685731

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input
method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I42ea55f2840eed70fe731119b259a5c625071e5b
Closes-Bug: #1792131
(cherry picked from commit e5b8b8b13a084fa1c8cb5f0f316acf0d02b6febd)

commit_message:
Internally defined middleware don't use stevedore

For internally defined middleware (URL Normalizer and AuthContext)
Do not use stevedore to load, apply directly. This also cleans up
a lingering entry in the setup.cfg for token_auth.

Test Changes:

* entry points test no longer looks for url_normalize and
build_auth_context

Change-Id: I58d3c23ad4f70668ada4eae94a94d3f5fe750b3b

[{'created': '2018-10-09 12:36:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: agent_alive() KeyError problem

The agent_alive() method may fail with a unhandled KeyError when it
tries to determine whether an agent that has been already deleted from
the AgentStats tracker is alive or not.

This patch handles the problem and in those cases it will just report
the agent as "dead".

Closes-Bug: #1796878
Change-Id: Ieee97721af09474fbbd4f03ab74da409f1e12833
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: agent_alive() KeyError problem

The agent_alive() method may fail with a unhandled KeyError when it
tries to determine whether an agent that has been already deleted from
the AgentStats tracker is alive or not.

This patch handles the problem and in those cases it will just report
the agent as "dead".

Closes-Bug: #1796878
Change-Id: Ieee97721af09474fbbd4f03ab74da409f1e12833

commit_message:
Add cross-horizon-npm

Horizon npm job depends on XStatic-* packages. Any breakig changes to XStatic-*
packages will be found only by npm tests.

Change-Id: I29a17c8a0ec857d3f1692440be052da83a7e0bdf

Extra routes are not configured on Router namespaces in dvr_snat
node with DVR-HA configuration.
This patch fixes the problem.

commit_message:
DVR-HA: Configure extra routes on router namespace in dvr_snat node

Extra routes are not configured on Router namespaces in dvr_snat
node with DVR-HA configuration.
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: If620b23564479042aa6f58640bcd6705e5eb52cf
Closes-Bug: #1797037
(cherry picked from commit 81652cd939ebaf7ea09e5f8dd31d8185619c8243)
